thesis.move_description: NYC-based Single Family Office acquiring $4.5M commercial real estate in Singapore. Targeting prime district Grade-A office or retail space for APAC diversification and stable income generation. Seeking shelter from US regulatory uncertainty and tax optimization through Singapore's favorable tax regime.
thesis.expected_outcome: 4% annual rental yield with 7% annual capital appreciation, generating combined 11% gross returns. Strategic positioning in APAC's most stable jurisdiction with established commercial tenant base and zero capital gains tax.

control_and_rails.ips_notes: NYC Family Office with established IPS. 20% allocation to international real estate, 15% to APAC exposure. Singapore commercial acquisition fits within mandate as APAC hedge against US market concentration. Income-generating focus with 4% rental yield and 7% appreciation targets align with wealth preservation strategy.
